result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Joseph Potack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Joseph Potack

records.addlTxt:
1:16 PM Defendant Cody Joseph Potack appeared in custody, with Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen, both appearing in person.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (22CM06, 22CF46, 22CF15, 18CF183) and recites appearances. State indicates global resolution.  State recites agreement.  All parties agree.  Plea Questionnaires submitted to Court.

Regarding 22CF15, DEF enters plea of Guilty to Count #1.  

Regarding 22CF46, Court indicates no prelim held yet.  State indicates INFO will be filed to mirror criminal complaint.  Atty Johansen waived prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Court indicates State will file Information to mirror criminal complaint.  Atty Johansen agrees to proceed with knowledge that State will file a mirrored Information.  DEF enters plea of Guilty to Count #1.  

DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds pleas were freely, voluntarily, and intelligently made.  Court accepts pleas and finds DEF guilty to Count 1 in 22CF15 and Count 1 in 22CF46.  Court indicates count #2 in 22CF46 is dismissed and read-in.  

Atty Johansen indicates revocation packet was received for case 18CF183, has been reviewed with DEF, and the there are no errors or corrections.  

State indicates compliance with victim's rights.  State makes statement prior to sentencing, indicating DEF eligible for ERP and Challenge in 22CF15 and 18CF183, but is not eligible in 22CF46.  Court finds victim's rights have been complied with.  Atty Johansen makes statement prior to sentencing, asking Court to accept joint recommendation.  Court questions if any victims wishing to speak, with no responses.  DEF makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court has discussion with DEF.  Court to follow agreement.  Court indicates DEF eligible for Challenge and ERP in cases where he meets eligibility requirements.  Court instructs DEF on providing DNA sample.  Neither parties have anything further.  Court addresses DEF.  
  

22CM06 = DRI.

22CF46:
Count 1 = 3.5 years in prison - 1.5 years of initial confinement + 2 years of extended supervision.  Concurrent to 22CF15 & 18CF183.  Credit of 142 days.  Conditions of extended supervision:  Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered. Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. 
Count 2 = Dismissed and read-in

22CF15 =  8 years in prison - 4 years of initial confinement + 4 years of extended supervision.  Concurrent to 22CF46 & 18CF183.  Credit of 173 days.  Conditions of extended supervision:  Pay Restitution of $965 to J.B. Ellis (joint and several with Sawyer County cases 22CF16 and 22CM07). Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered. Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. 

18CF183: = 7 years in prison - 4 years of initial confinement + 3 years of extended supervision.  Concurrent to 22CF15 & 22CF46  Credit of 416 days.  Conditions of extended supervision:  Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered. Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.

2:08 PM Defendant Cody Joseph Potack in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Cody Joseph Potack. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Johansen makes statement.  State indicates PSI filed February 2020.  Further discussion takes place regarding PSI.  Court to proceed with PSI previously filed.  Agreement has not been reached, working towards global resolution.   Court sets plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:43AM Defendant Cody Joseph Potack appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail, with Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen appearing by video. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Johansen makes statement, requests sentencing hearing and a PSI ordered.  State makes a statement on PSI, indicates 3 open cases + 1 SEHR, requests PLEAH/Sentencing Hearing.  Atty Johansen agrees with State, requests PLEAH/SEH.  Court sets sentencing hearing for 5/23/22 at 2:30PM.  Court indicates Atty Johansen able to appear by zoom.  DEF indicates he would like to appear in person.  State indicates they will prepare writ for personal appearance of DEF.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:52 PM Defendant Cody Joseph Potack in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen appears by zoom.  Defendant Cody Joseph Potack in custody appears by video. Kenneth Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   DEF to contact PD office to have attny appointment.   Through counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
